content.rendered:
Photo by tookapic

Yes, it really is Friday already, which means it’s This Week in Genesis #19 and this week there’s a Theme Bonanza!

That’s right, this week there’s new themes from Minimal Genesis, Restored 316 Designs and WPStudio. Plus, there’s two new themes on the horizon from StudioPress and a ‘theme tease’ from the lovely Susan Ramsey.

Now to forget non-theme goings on of course, which include a lot of activity on Genesis accessible menus; Gary Jones announcing a UK Genesis podcast with WordPress co-founder, Mike Little; plus the usual showcase round-up and news.

Let’s begin.

Themes

First up, GenesisWP.guide favourite Ryan Townley releases a fantastic new theme for his Minimal Genesis project entitled Pierce.

Introducing: Pierce, a brand new #genesiswp theme http://t.co/0EEwnelhu2

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) September 18, 2015

Plus, Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 Designs launches a beautiful new theme designed specifically for authors, Novelty.

Introducing Novelty: An author commerce #genesiswp #wordpress theme! http://t.co/608xfNKdFT pic.twitter.com/j3Urd4Z9aZ

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) September 22, 2015

And, if all of that wasn’t enough, WPStudio announces the release of their new theme, Journey.

Say hello to my latest WordPress theme Journey. https://t.co/Tx6e0bdhaf #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/IXKKfajkTP

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) September 22, 2015

Next, if you’re itching for a new StudioPress theme soon, you’re in luck!

First up, Lauren Mancke has a sneak peek of the upcoming Workstation Pro theme and suggests it’ll be released by the end of September.

Here's a sneak peek of the new theme we're working on // Workstation Pro Theme by @laurenmancke for @studiopress https://t.co/uAHe9mgHUw

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) September 21, 2015

And if you’ve been salivating over Brian Gardner’s Atmosphere Pro theme (which he’s teased a few times), he confirms – in response to a question from Louis Blythe – that it’s slated for release after Workstation Pro.

@louisblythe @studiopress Yes, it’ll be released after the other one you saw and favorited.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 23, 2015

Oh and one more thing I had to include, this preview of Susan Ramsey’s new Genesis theme, Elise.

I'm working on my first #GenesisWP theme. Meet #Elise, named in honor of a special young lady. @lindseyriel pic.twitter.com/opMaaJQaJk

— Susan Ramsey (@GraphDesigning) September 24, 2015

Go Susan!

‘Genesis Responsive Menu: Accessible Edition’

Next up, I want to take a break from the regular format of these updates to bring some attention to an important discussion (and a lot of hard work) that’s been going on in the #accessibility channel of the Genesis Slack group.

First, some context. If you weren’t aware, Genesis 2.2 was released at the end of August and brought about some fantastic accessibility improvements.

Part of these improvements include support for more accessible menus (allowing users to ‘tab’ through menu items and so on).

Now, these features rely on having accessibility ‘switched on’ in the child theme that Genesis is using, but this is a small change in most cases (for more details see Jesse Petersen’s ‘Two Things You Need to Do to Your Genesis 2.2 Theme’ article).

However in some cases, where a child theme includes a specific responsive (mobile) menu and also has accessibility ‘switched on’, there has been a small bug where responsive menu items with sub-menus might ‘flicker’ or behave unexpectedly.

In short, nothing that’s going to bring your site down, so there’s no panic or alarm here, but something that could be improved upon in the child themes where this is the case.

Not to be put off, the crack team of Robin Cornett, Marcy Diaz and Bradley Potter (with contributions from Gary Jones, Ozzy Rodriguez and Rian Rietveld) – and apologies if I missed anyone else – have been hard at work looking at solutions for this and last week (it just missed my update sadly) Robin shared her work in her excellent post:

Genesis Responsive Menu: Accessible Edition

In her post, Robin explains the whole thing way better than me(!) and also provides all the code for an accessible responsive menu solution based on all the discussions and testing in the #accessibility channel.

If you’re a theme developer (or child theme user) and have noticed a responsive menu issue with accessibility switched on in your theme or you’re planning to build a new child theme with a responsive menu I encourage you to check her post.

Having dipped in and out of the discussion on the #accessibility channel of the Genesis Slack group, I can only take my hat off to all those involved and in my mind this is one of the best examples of why the Genesis community has such a fantastic reputation for cooperation and working for the ‘greater good’.

Go team!

Genesis Responsive Menu: Accessible Edition http://t.co/7FT5HjxpDs pic.twitter.com/jiiYfzwob1

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) September 18, 2015

As an endnote, it will of course be interesting to see how StudioPress handle this in their upcoming Workstation Pro and Atmosphere Pro themes (Robin has been in touch with StudioPress to share her work) due for release soon.

However, as mentioned above, we shouldn’t have too long to wait with Workstation Pro slated for release soon and Atmosphere Pro due to follow sometime after.

Showcase

Ryan Townley, that man again, launches a new site for data41.com

Just launched a new #genesiswp website for performance management consulting firm, Data41: http://t.co/N7JFiIWrw2 pic.twitter.com/LhRDazRE1Z

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) September 24, 2015

Jonathan Holborn launches a new site based on the popular Altitude Pro theme for actor Danny Fehsenfeld, dannyfehsenfeld.com

New actor site for Danny Fehsenfeld. Let me know what you all think! http://t.co/IqNB4GcBLb

— Jonathan Holborn (@JonnyAndy) September 24, 2015

And finally, artaxis got in touch to share their new Genesis based site, artaxis.org

Yesterday, we launched the brand new Artaxis website! Check it out at http://t.co/lcxzdQPhWd #artaxis #ceramics pic.twitter.com/COchHZEj91

— artaxis.org (@artaxis_org) September 17, 2015

(For more showcase sites, check out the Genesis Showcase Facebook group).

Podcasts

First up this week, the latest OfficeHours.fm podcast sees Carrie Dils chatting with two people I’m a big fan of, Jennifer Bourn and Brian Bourn, the husband and wife team behind recommended Genesis design and development firm, Bourn Creative.

No live show this week, but I've got a NEW episode for you with @jenniferbourn & @brianbourn: http://t.co/bXzrSUopkj #cabopress

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) September 23, 2015

And, in the Genesis Slack group, Gary Jones confirms that there won’t be a UK Genesis podcast this week, but there will be one with WordPress co-founder Mike Little in two weeks time (and if you’ve got a question for Mike be sure to let Gary know).

If you could ask #WordPress co-founder @mikelittlezed1 any question, what would it be? #ukgenesis #genesiswp

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) September 20, 2015

News

Congrats to Katie Rosebraugh, the newest addition to the Genesis Recommended Developers page over at StudioPress!

Happy to announce that @mskatiegail has been added to the Genesis Developer page — http://t.co/nOr9rx5DFM #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 22, 2015

And finally…

After embedding hundreds of tweets from other people over the last few weeks, GenesisWP.guide is now on Twitter itself.

Follow @GenesisWPguide or just click that big, shiny button below.

Follow @GenesisWPguide

Oh and one other new thing this week, just because:

Question of the week:

What’s your favourite Genesis theme shop and why?

Let me know in the comments below.

PS If you didn’t enter already, Sunday is the last day to win a Restored 316 Designs theme as part of my Lauren Gaige interview!

PPS If a weekly round-up just isn’t enough and you need a WordPress and / or Genesis news fix every day, check out the Daily Bolt.

excerpt.rendered: Theme bonanza! New themes from Minimal Genesis, Restored 316 Designs & WPStudio. Theme news from StudioPress. Plus news on accessible Genesis mobile menus.
